titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Smalls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER - Observing that no substantive motion or petition has been filed, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant's motion to appoint counsel (filing 150) and motion for leave to proceed in forma pauperis (filing 151) are denied. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party) (JAB)

titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Smalls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: MEMORANDUM AND ORDER as to defendant Tommie Thompson (2). The defendant has filed or tendered for filing a motion (filing 153) that I construe as seeking a reduction of sentence pursuant to the retroactive amendments to the "crack" Guidelines. The Federal Public Defender is herewith appointed to represent the defendant. No later than December 31, 2009, the probation office shall provide the undersigned and counsel of record with a "Retroactive Sentencing Worksheet." No later than January 15, 2010, counsel of record shall confer. The application to proceed in forma pauperis (filing 155) is granted. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (Copy mailed to pro se party and provided to Probation)(JAB)

extension.searchTitle: USCOURTS 8:98-cr-00069; United States of America v. Smalls et al;

The Federal Public Defender is herewith appointed to represent the defendant. No later than December 31, 2009, the probation office shall provide the undersigned and counsel of record with a "Retroactive Sentencing Worksheet." No later than January 15, 2010, counsel of record shall confer. The application to proceed in forma pauperis (filing 155) is granted. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. titleInfo.title: United States of America v. Smalls et al
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER REGARDING MOTION FOR SENTENCE REDUCTION PURSUANT TO 18:3582(c)(2) as to defendant Tommie Thompson (2). Motion153 of the defendant is granted and the defendant's previously imposed sentence of imprisonment (as reflected in the judgment issued 7/29/1999) of 292 months is reduced to 235 months. Except as provided above, all provisions of the judgment dated 7/29/1999 shall remain in effect. Effective date: 12/3/2009. Joint stipulation (filing 159) is granted as provided herein but otherwise denied. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (1 certified copy to USM)(JAB)
